<span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><select name="wpforms[fields][11]" id="wpforms-67492-field_11" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required"  required><option value=""  selected='selected'></option><option value="3 - 6 months" >3 - 6 months</option><option value="6 months - 1 year" >6 months - 1 year</option><option value="1 - 2 years" >1 - 2 years</option><option value="2 - 5 years" >2 - 5 years</option><option value="5+ years" >5+ years</option></select></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_13-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-select wpforms-conditional-trigger" data-field-id="13"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_13">Do you have revenue? <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><select name="wpforms[fields][13]" id="wpforms-67492-field_13" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required"  required><option value=""  selected='selected'></option><option value="Yes" >Yes</option><option value="No" >No</option></select></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_14-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-text wpforms-conditional-field wpforms-conditional-show" data-field-id="14" style="display:none;"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_14">What was your revenue in the last full calendar month? <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><input type="text" id="wpforms-67492-field_14" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required" name="wpforms[fields][14]" required><div class="wpforms-field-description">(Please use USD. If none, enter '0')</div></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_16-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-text wpforms-conditional-field wpforms-conditional-show" data-field-id="16" style="display:none;"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_16">What was your revenue in the last quarter? <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><input type="text" id="wpforms-67492-field_16" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required" name="wpforms[fields][16]" required></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_17-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-text wpforms-conditional-field wpforms-conditional-show" data-field-id="17" style="display:none;"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_17">What was your revenue in the last 12 months? <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><input type="text" id="wpforms-67492-field_17" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required" name="wpforms[fields][17]" required></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_18-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-textarea wpforms-conditional-field wpforms-conditional-show" data-field-id="18" style="display:none;"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_18">Anything else you would like us to know regarding your revenue or growth rate?</label><textarea id="wpforms-67492-field_18" class="wpforms-field-medium" name="wpforms[fields][18]" ></textarea></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_19-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-textarea" data-field-id="19"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_19">Why did you pick this idea to work on? Do you have domain expertise in this area? <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><textarea id="wpforms-67492-field_19" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required" name="wpforms[fields][19]" required></textarea></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_20-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-textarea" data-field-id="20"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_20">What&#039;s unique about what your product / business?  <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><textarea id="wpforms-67492-field_20" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required" name="wpforms[fields][20]" required></textarea></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_21-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-textarea" data-field-id="21"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_21">Who are your competitors, and who might become competitors? Who do you fear most? <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><textarea id="wpforms-67492-field_21" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required" name="wpforms[fields][21]" required></textarea></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_22-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-textarea" data-field-id="22"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_22">What do you understand about your business that other companies in the industry just don&#039;t get? <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><textarea id="wpforms-67492-field_22" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required" name="wpforms[fields][22]" required></textarea></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_23-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-select wpforms-conditional-trigger" data-field-id="23"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_23">Have you incorporated, or formed any legal entity (like a LLC)? <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><select name="wpforms[fields][23]" id="wpforms-67492-field_23" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required"  required><option value=""  selected='selected'></option><option value="Yes" >Yes</option><option value="No" >No</option></select></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_24-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-text country was the entity formed? <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><input type="text" id="wpforms-67492-field_24" class="wpforms-field-medium wpforms-field-required" breakdown of the equity ownership in percentages among the founders, employees and any other stockholders. <span class="wpforms-required-label">*</span></label><textarea id="wpforms-67492-field_12" class="wpforms-field-medium" name="wpforms[fields][26]" ></textarea><div class="wpforms-field-description">(Pending lawsuits, co-founders who have left, etc.)</div></div><div id="wpforms-67492-field_27-container" class="wpforms-field wpforms-field-textarea" data-field-id="27"><label class="wpforms-field-label" for="wpforms-67492-field_27">What convinced you to apply to WPBeginner Growth Accelerator?</label><textarea id="wpforms-67492-field_27" class="wpforms-field-medium" name="wpforms[fields][27]" ></textarea></div></div><div class="wpforms-field <h4>Final Thoughts</h4>\
<p>I am committed to the WordPress ecosystem, and I have two main goals with this fund:</p>\
<ol>\
<li>Help WordPress-focused companies succeed</li>\
<li>Help introduce more user-focused WordPress products</li>\
</ol>\
<p>If you like a specific WordPress products that you think we should invest in, then please reach out to them and let them know about the growth accelerator fund.</p>\
<p>Yours Truly,<br />\
Syed Balkhi<br />\
Founder of WPBeginner</p>\

Page in WordPress";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:4:"link";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:82:"https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-themes/how-to-create-a-custom-homepage-in-wordpress/";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:8:"comments";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:91:"https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-themes/how-to-create-a-custom-homepage-in-wordpress/#comments";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:7:"pubDate";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:31:"Wed, 28 Aug 2019 12:44:01 +0000";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:8:"category";a:8:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:6:"Themes";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:1;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:29:"custom home page in wordpress";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:2;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:15:"custom homepage";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:3;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:16:"custom page hack";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:4;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:24:"custom page in wordpress";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:5;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:45:"how to create a custom home page in wordpress";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:6;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:13:"wordpress cms";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:7;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:24:"wordpress magazine style";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:4:"guid";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:32:"http://www.wpbeginner.com/?p=916";s:7:"attribs";a:1:{s:0:"";a:1:{s:11:"isPermaLink";s:5:"false";}}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:11:"description";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:493:"<p>You may see many websites on the web using a custom homepage for their WordPress. In this tutorial we will show you how you can create a custom homepage by combining the use of custom page template, and WordPress admin panel.</p>\
<p>The post <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-themes/how-to-create-a-custom-homepage-in-wordpress/">How to Create a Custom Home Page in WordPress</a> appeared first on <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.wpbeginner.com">WPBeginner</a>.</p>\
";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:32:"http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/";a:1:{s:7:"creator";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:15:"Editorial Staff";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:40:"http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/";a:1:{s:7:"encoded";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:16438:"<p>Often users ask us if it&#8217;s possible to create a custom homepage in WordPress. </p>\
<p>By default, WordPress shows your blog posts on the homepage. However as a <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-tutorials/how-to-make-a-small-business-website-step-by-step/" title="How to Make a Small Business Website – Step by Step (2019)">business website</a>, you may want to create a more engaging homepage that helps users find what they need and boost your sales conversion. </p>\
<p>In this article, we will show you how to easily create a custom homepage in WordPress. We will show multiple methods, and you can choose the one that&#8217;s easier for you. </p>\
<p><img title="Creating a custom homepage in WordPress" src="https://cdn3.wpbeginner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/customhomepage.png" alt="Creating a custom homepage in WordPress" width="550" height="340" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-66040" /></p>\
<h4>What is a homepage?</h4>\
<p>A homepage is a default introductory page or the frontpage of a website. It is the page that appears when someone enters your website&#8217;s domain name in their browser&#8217;s address bar. </p>\
<p><img title="Homepage example" src="https://cdn.wpbeginner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/homepage-example.jpg" alt="Homepage example" width="550" height="336" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-66031" /></p>\
<p>The main purpose of the homepage is to introduce users to your website or business. Ideally, it should provide users essential information about your business, so they can continue exploring other pages on your site. </p>\
<p>By default, WordPress displays your recent blog posts on the homepage. This is not good as it only shows a few of your current articles. </p>\
<p>If you run a business website, then the default homepage does not tell users about your business, products or services. It also doesn&#8217;t provide users a way to contact you. </p>\
<p>The good news is that WordPress already comes with a built-in functionality to create custom home page. </p>\
<h4>Selecting a Custom Page to be Used as Homepage in WordPress</h4>\
<p>WordPress allows you to easily use any page on your website as your homepage. You can simply go to <strong>Pages &raquo; Add New</strong> page inside WordPress admin area to create a new page. </p>\
<p>Let&#8217;s give this page a title &#8216;Home&#8217; and publish it. You will use this page as your custom homepage.  </p>\
<p>Don&#8217;t worry about layout or design at the moment. We will show you how to design your homepage later in this article. </p>\
<p>Now, if you want to run a blog on your site, then you need to create a <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-tutorials/how-to-create-a-separate-page-for-blog-posts-in-wordpress/" title="How to Create a Separate Page for Blog Posts in WordPress">separate blog page</a> to display your posts. </p>\
<p>Once again, go to <strong>Pages &raquo; Add New</strong> page and create a page titled &#8216;Blog&#8217;. Go ahead and publish the blank page. </p>\
<p>After creating the pages, you need to visit <strong>Settings &raquo; Reading</strong> page in your WordPress admin. From here select &#8216;A static page&#8217; option under &#8216;Your homepage displays&#8217; section. </p>\
<p><img title="Select home and blog pages" src="https://cdn.wpbeginner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/select-homepage.png" alt="Select home and blog pages" width="550" height="249" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-66032" /></p>\
<p>Next, you need to select the homepage and the blog pages you created earlier. </p>\
<p>Don&#8217;t forget to click on the &#8216;Save changes&#8217; button to store your settings. </p>\
<p>Now that you have set up a page to be used as your custom homepage, let&#8217;s start designing the custom home page for your WordPress site. </p>\
<h4>Method 1. Create a Custom Homepage in WordPress using Gutenberg</h4>\
<p>WordPress introduced a new <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/how-to-use-the-new-wordpress-block-editor/" title="How to Use the New WordPress Block Editor (Gutenberg Tutorial)">block-based eidtor called Gutenberg</a> in December 2018. This new editor allows users to not just write content but create beautiful layouts as well. </p>\
<p>It uses blocks for each content element which enables you to organize content blocks to create a page structure that you like. </p>\
<p>WordPress includes blocks that can be used for design purposes like <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/cover-image-vs-featured-image-in-wordpress/" title="Cover Image vs. Featured Image in WordPress Block Editor (Beginner’s Guide)">cover images</a>, <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/plugins/how-to-add-multi-column-content-in-wordpress-posts-no-html-required/" title="How to Add Multi-Column Content in WordPress Posts (No HTML Required)">columns</a>, tables, text and media, <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/how-to-create-an-image-gallery-in-wordpress/" title="How to Create an Image Gallery in WordPress (Step by Step)">galleries</a>, and more. </p>\
<p><img title="Editing your custom homepage layout using Gutenberg" src="https://cdn.wpbeginner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/homepage-gutenberg.jpg" alt="Editing your custom homepage layout using Gutenberg" width="550" height="315" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-66034" /></p>\
<p>Each block comes with its own settings, which allows you to customize its appearance to meet your design requirements. </p>\
<p>You can extend available blocks with <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/showcase/best-gutenberg-blocks-plugins-for-wordpress/" title="15 Best Gutenberg Blocks Plugins for WordPress (Super Useful)">Gutenberg block plugins</a> to add more blocks to your arsenal. These plugins allow you to use advanced elements like testimonials, sliders, services, and other common design features.</p>\
<p><img title="Using advanced block library plugins to make homepage layout" src="https://cdn3.wpbeginner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/gutenberg-ultimate-addons.jpg" alt="Using advanced block library plugins to make homepage layout" width="550" height="344" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-66035" /> </p>\
<p>You can also use <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/showcase/gutenberg-friendly-wordpress-themes/" title="25 Best Gutenberg Friendly WordPress Themes (2019)">Gutenberg ready WordPress themes</a> which give you more flexibility to work with blocks. </p>\
<p>We recommend using <a title="Astra WordPress Theme" href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/refer/astra-wordpress-theme/" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Astra</a>, it comes with Gutenberg website templates that you can install using their <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/astra-sites/" title="Astra Starter Sites" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">Astra Starter Sites</a> plugin. </p>\
<p>Once you import a template, you can edit it using the default WordPress editor and create a highly professional looking homepage for your website. </p>\
<h4>Method 2. Create a Custom Homepage in WordPress using Page Builders</h4>\
<p>This method is very easy and does not require any coding or design skills. For this method, you will be using a <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/best-drag-and-drop-page-builders-for-wordpress/" title="6 Best Drag and Drop WordPress Page Builders Compared (2019)">WordPress page builder plugin</a>. </p>\
<p>A page builder plugin allows you to easily create custom page layouts by using a simple drag and drop interface. </p>\
<p>We recommend using <a title="Beaver Builder" href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/refer/beaver-builder/" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Beaver Builder</a> because it is the most beginner-friendly page builder plugin on the market. It comes with dozens of custom homepage templates that you can install with a single click. </p>\
<p>Once installed, you can edit the template using point and click tools. You can replace content and images with your own content, and even extend the template by adding more modules, widgets, and sections. </p>\
<p><img title="Creating a custom homepage using Beaver Builder" src="https://cdn3.wpbeginner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/homepage-beaverbuilder.jpg" alt="Creating a custom homepage using Beaver Builder" width="550" height="344" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-66036" /></p>\
<p><a rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank" title="Beaver Builder" href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/refer/beaver-builder/" data-shortcode="true">Beaver Builder</a> also gives you access to <a title="Beaver Themer" href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/refer/beaver-themer/" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Beaver Themer</a>, which allows you to <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-themes/how-to-easily-create-a-custom-wordpress-theme/" title="How to Easily Create a Custom WordPress Theme (without Any Code)">make your own custom WordPress theme</a> without writing any code. </p>\
<p>For more details, see our guide on how to easily <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/plugins/how-to-create-custom-wordpress-layouts-with-beaver-builder/" title="How to Create Custom WordPress Layouts with Beaver Builder">create custom WordPress layouts using Beaver Builder</a>. </p>\
<p>As an alternative, you can also try <a title="Elementor Pro" href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/refer/elementor-pro/" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">Elementor</a>. It is also an immensely popular WordPress page builder plugin. It also comes with drag and drop templates and an easy to use interface. </p>\
<p><img title="Creating a homepage layout using Elementor" src="https://cdn3.wpbeginner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/homepage-elementor.jpg" alt="Creating a homepage layout using Elementor" width="550" height="344" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-66037" /></p>\
<p>For details, see our tutorial on creating <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/plugins/how-to-create-custom-wordpress-layouts-with-elementor/" title="How to Create Custom WordPress Layouts With Elementor">custom page layouts with Elementor</a>. </p>\
<h4>Method 3. Manually Create a Custom Homepage in WordPress (Coding Required)</h4>\
<p>This method is not recommended for beginners as it requires coding. You need to be familiar with the WordPress coding practices, PHP, HTML, and CSS to use this method. </p>\
<p>Let&#8217;s see how this works. </p>\
<p>Your WordPress theme is made up of different files. Some of these files are called templates and control the display of certain areas of your website. See our <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-themes/wordpress-template-hierarchy-explained/" title="Beginner’s Guide to WordPress Template Hierarchy (Cheat Sheet)">WordPress template hierarchy cheat sheet</a> for more details. </p>\
<p>One of these templates is called front-page.php. If your theme has this template, then WordPress will automatically use it to display your custom homepage. </p>\
<p><img title="front-page.php template" src="https://cdn3.wpbeginner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/site-front-page.png" alt="front-page.php template" width="550" height="531" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-66038" /></p>\
<p>However, if your theme does not have it, then you can create one for yourself/  </p>\
<p>Simply create a blank file and save it as front-page.php. After that you need to upload it to your current theme&#8217;s folder on your <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wordpress-hosting/" title="How to Choose the Best WordPress Hosting in 2019 (Compared)">WordPress hosting</a> account using FTP. </p>\
<p>As soon as you upload this file, WordPress will start using it to display your homepage. However, since this file is completely empty, you will see a blank white page. </p>\
<p>To fix this, you can start adding your HTML code to display contents of your custom homepage. An easier approach is to use the existing code and templates in your WordPress theme. </p>\
<p>For example, you can use the same header and footer. WordPress makes it super easy to include those templates. </p>\
<p>Here is a sample code where we removed the content and sidebars while preserving the header and navigation templates from the theme. </p>\
<pre class="brush: php; title: ; notranslate">\
&lt;?php /* \
This page is used to display the static frontpage. \
*/ \
\
// Fetch theme header template\
get_header(); ?&gt;\
\	&lt;div id=&quot;primary&quot; &lt;?php astra_primary_class(); ?&gt;&gt;\
\
\	&lt;div class=&quot;custom-homepage-container&quot;&gt; \
\
\	You custom homepage code goes here\
\
\	&lt;/div&gt; \
\
\	&lt;/div&gt;&lt;!-- #primary --&gt;\
//Fetch the theme footer template \
&lt;?php get_footer(); ?&gt;\
</pre>\
<h4>Tips on Making an Effective Custom Homepage in WordPress</h4>\
<p>Your website&#8217;s homepage is the most important page on your website. Users look at it to learn more about your business, products, and services. </p>\
<p>We recommend keeping your homepage design as simple as possible. On our own websites, we have learned that our users find simpler layouts more helpful. </p>\
<p>Try to avoid clutter, but don&#8217;t hide important information that your users would want to see on the homepage. You also need to prioritize which content appears first in your layout. </p>\
<p>Write down the goals you want to achieve before making a custom homepage for your website. This exercise will help you come up with a clear design goal. </p>\
<p>For most businesses and blogs, the number one goal is to convert website visitors into customers. To achieve this, you&#8217;ll need <a href="https://optinmonster.com" title="OptinMonster">OptinMonster</a>. </p>\
<p>It is the <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/best-wordpress-popup-plugin/" title="5 Best WordPress Popup Plugins of 2019 (Performance Compared)">best WordPress popup plugin</a> and lead generation software. It helps you convert website visitors into subscribers and paying customers. </p>\
<p>Next, you would want to track how your custom homepage is performing. For this, you need to <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/how-to-install-google-analytics-in-wordpress/" title="How to Install Google Analytics in WordPress for Beginners">install Google Analytics</a> on your website. It helps you see where your users are coming from and what they do on your website. </p>\
<p>You would also want to make it easier for your users to contact you. For this, you will need the <a href="https://wpforms.com" title="WPForms">WPForms</a> plugin which is the <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/plugins/5-best-contact-form-plugins-for-wordpress-compared/" title="5 Best Contact Form Plugins for WordPress Compared">best WordPress form plugin</a> on the market. </p>\
<p>You can also add a <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-tutorials/how-to-add-clickable-phone-numbers-for-smartphones-in-wordpress/" title="How to Add a Click-to-Call Button in WordPress (Step by Step)">click to call button</a> your website, so people can easily call your <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/showcase/best-business-phone-services/" title="6 Best Business Phone Services for Small Business (2019)">business phone</a>.</p>\
<p>Lastly, we recommend you to look around at your competitors and other popular sites in your industry/niche. We are not asking you to copy their design, but to learn from their best practices and then apply it on your own homepage layout. </p>\
<p>We hope this article helped you easily create a custom homepage in WordPress. You may also want to see our <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/how-to-increase-your-blog-traffic/" title="How to Increase Your Blog Traffic – The Easy Way (27 Proven Tips)">proven tips to increase your blog traffic</a>. </p>\
<p>If you liked this article, then please subscribe to our <a href="http://youtube.com/wpbeginner?sub_confirmation=1" title="WPBeginner on YouTube" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">YouTube Channel</a> for WordPress video tutorials. You can also find us on <a href="http://twitter.com/wpbeginner" title="WPBeginner on Twitter" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a> and <a href="https://www.facebook.com/wpbeginner" title="WPBeginner on Facebook" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Facebook</a>.</p>\

\	\	";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";s:5:"child";a:5:{s:0:"";a:7:{s:5:"title";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:63:"How to Easily Add a Call Now Button to WordPress (Step by Step)";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:4:"link";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:53:"https://www.isitwp.com/add-call-now-button-wordpress/";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:8:"comments";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:61:"https://www.isitwp.com/add-call-now-button-wordpress/#respond";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:7:"pubDate";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:31:"Fri, 30 Aug 2019 16:51:35 +0000";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:8:"category";a:4:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:19:"WordPress Tutorials";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:1;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:15:"call now button";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:2;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:18:"wp call now button";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:3;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:18:"wp call now plugin";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:4:"guid";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:32:"https://www.isitwp.com/?p=236450";s:7:"attribs";a:1:{s:0:"";a:1:{s:11:"isPermaLink";s:5:"false";}}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:11:"description";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:598:"<p>Want to add a call now button to your WordPress website? Adding a call now button to your site makes it easier for your visitors to call you right from your website. In fact, almost half of the internet traffic is from mobile devices, so if your website doesn&#8217;t have a call now button, you&#8217;re [&#8230;]</p>\
<p>The post <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.isitwp.com/add-call-now-button-wordpress/">How to Easily Add a Call Now Button to WordPress (Step by Step)</a> appeared first on <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.isitwp.com">IsItWP - WordPress Technology Lookup Tool</a>.</p>\
";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:32:"http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/";a:1:{s:7:"creator";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:14:"Editorial Team";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:40:"http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/";a:1:{s:7:"encoded";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:12373:"<p>Want to add a call now button to your WordPress website? Adding a call now button to your site makes it easier for your visitors to call you right from your website.  </p>\
<p>In fact, almost half of the internet traffic is from mobile devices, so if your website doesn&#8217;t have a call now button, you&#8217;re likely losing a lot of potential leads. </p>\
<p>In today&#8217;s article, we&#8217;ll show you how to easily add a call now button to your WordPress website with a plugin and without a plugin. </p>\
<h3>Why Add a Call Now Button to Your Website?</h3>\
<p>Adding a call now button to your website can be of great advantage for you and your business. </p>\
<p>This makes it convenient and hassle-free for your visitors to get in touch with you right from your website.  </p>\
<p>With a call now button on your WordPress site, you are actually converting your website traffic into valuable leads. And by integrating a professional business phone service, you can share numbers with employees, do call forwarding, etc. </p>\
<p>Let&#8217;s take a look at how to add a call now button to WordPress. </p>\
<h3>Method 1: Adding Call Now Button Using a Plugin</h3>\
<p>The easiest way to add a call now button to WordPress is by using the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-call-button/" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">WP Call Button</a> plugin. </p>\
<p>With this plugin, you can easily add a call now button without writing a single line of code. You can also do it from your Classic editor or the Gutenberg editor, whichever is active on your site. </p>\
<p>First off, <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/install-wordpress-plugin/" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">install and activate the WP Call Button plugin</a> on your site. After installation, it&#8217;s the time to configure the plugin. </p>\
<h3>Configuring Call Now Button Plugin to Add Sticky Button</h3>\
<p>Once your plugin is activated, go to <strong>Settings &raquo; WP Call Button</strong> on your WordPress dashboard. In this page, you will see 3 different tabs. </p>\
<ul>\
<li>Sticky Call Button</li>\
<li>Static Call Button</li>\
<li>About Us</li>\
</ul>\
<p>By going to sticky call button tab, you can add a sticky call button to your WordPress website. This means that the button will be visible no matter how far you scroll down the page. </p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wp-call-button-settings-1.jpg" alt="wp call button, call now" width="775" height="488" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236755" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wp-call-button-settings-1.jpg 775w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wp-call-button-settings-1-300x189.jpg 300w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wp-call-button-settings-1-768x484.jpg 768w" sizes="(max-width: 775px) 100vw, 775px" /></p>\
<p>Let&#8217;s go ahead and turn on the Call Now Button status. Then enter your business contact number to which you want your visitors to call. </p>\
<div class="alert alert-warning">If you don’t have a business phone number, then you can get one from <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/refer/nextiva/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" data-nojs="true" >Nextiva</a>. This is the company we use for our <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/best-business-phone-services/" title="10 Best Business VoIP Phone Services for Any Budget &#038; Size">business VoIP phone</a>.<br />\
</div>\
<p>You can then work on the appearance of your call now button. </p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-now-button-appearance.png" alt="call now button" width="645" height="500" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236758" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-now-button-appearance.png 645w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-now-button-appearance-300x233.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 645px) 100vw, 645px" /></p>\
<p>You have the option to add the button text, select its position and color. You can also select where you want to display the button. By default, the button will appear on all pages of your website. But you can also hide it from certain pages if you want.</p>\
<p>Once you&#8217;re done making these changes, click on the save button at the end of the page. That&#8217;s it. Your visitors can now call you on your registered business number right from your website. </p>\
<h3>B. Adding a Static Call Now Button to Your Website</h3>\
<p>You can also add a static call now button to your website. Let&#8217;s see how to do this on Classic editor and the Gutenberg editor. </p>\
<h3>Using the Classic Editor</h3>\
<p>To add the button, go to <strong>Settings &raquo; WP Call Button &raquo; Static Call Button</strong> </p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Static-Call-Button.png" alt="" width="700" height="607" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236761" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Static-Call-Button.png 700w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Static-Call-Button-300x260.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 700px) 100vw, 700px" /></p>\
<p>In this page, you&#8217;ll see a few customization options. Using these options, you can change the text and color of your button. You can even hide the phone icon from the button if you want. However, we&#8217;d recommend you not to do that because the phone icon helps you send a clear message to your users about its purpose. </p>\
<p>Once all the changes are made, simply copy the shortcode and paste it on the page or post wherever you want to display your button. That&#8217;s all. Your call now button will now be reflected on your website post or page. </p>\
<h3>Using the Gutenberg Editor</h3>\
<p>If you are using the Gutenberg editor, just go to the particular page where you want to display your call now button. You can either edit an existing page or create a new one. Now you can add the WP Call Now block by using the &#8216;+&#8217; symbol. </p>\
<p>You will have the same customization options here just like the Classic Editor. You can also change your button text and color to match with your website&#8217;s appearance. You can also hide or show the phone icon on your button if you want. Once you&#8217;re done customizing it, save your settings. </p>\
<p>If it&#8217;s an existing post, you&#8217;ll have to click on the Update button for your button to start working. If it&#8217;s a new post, make sure to hit the Publish button. Your button should show on your post right away. </p>\
<h3>Adding A Call Now Button to Widget</h3>\
<p>With WP Call Button, you can add your call now button to your website&#8217;s widgetized areas. To do that, you just need to go to your dashboard and click on <strong>Appearance &raquo; Widgets</strong>. </p>\
<p>Now drag the button option and drop it in your widget area.</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Wp-call-in-the-widgets.png" alt="" width="586" height="430" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236766" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Wp-call-in-the-widgets.png 586w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Wp-call-in-the-widgets-300x220.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 586px) 100vw, 586px" /></p>\
<p>You can then work on its text, color etc. like you did in the above processes.   </p>\
<h3>Adding a Call Now Button Manually</h3>\
<p>Apart from using a plugin, you can also use the call now button by adding a simple HTML code. This method too is a simple one and you can easily use it by following the process we are about to explain here. </p>\
<p>These links will open the phone app on mobile devices. On desktop computers, Mac users will see an option to open the link in Facetime, whereas Windows 10 users will see the option to open it in Skype. </p>\
<p>You can start by going to your WordPress text editor and adding the following HTML code. </p>\
<pre class="brush: xml; title: ; notranslate">&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;tel:+15555551212&amp;quot;&amp;gt;+1 (555) 555-1212&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt; \
  \
&amp;lt;a href=&amp;quot;tel:15555551212&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Call Me&amp;lt;/a&amp;gt;</pre>\
<p>Don&#8217;t forget to replace the phone number in the above with your own business number. Feel free to customize the anchor text (Call Me) as well.</p>\
<p>This link can be placed anywhere on your website. You can also use a phone icon next to your call now link. You can do this by clicking on<strong> Media &raquo; Add New</strong> </p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Add-media.jpg" alt="" width="650" height="356" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236770" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Add-media.jpg 650w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Add-media-300x164.jpg 300w" sizes="(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px" /></p>\
<p>Now upload the phone icon that you want to display on your screen. Once the image is uploaded, click on it and copy the image URL. </p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/media.jpg" alt="" width="608" height="668" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236773" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/media.jpg 608w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/media-273x300.jpg 273w" sizes="(max-width: 608px) 100vw, 608px" /></p>\
<p>Now go to the post or page where you added the HTML code. You can then wrap the image URL within the phone link like this:</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wp-call-button-image-icon.png" alt="" width="544" height="300" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236774" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wp-call-button-image-icon.png 544w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wp-call-button-image-icon-300x165.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 544px) 100vw, 544px" /></p>\
<p>Upon previewing the post, you will now see the phone icon along with the number. When a visitor clicks on this image, they can directly reach out to you on your business number. </p>\
<h3>Adding Call Now Button to Navigation Menus Manually</h3>\
<p>Let&#8217;s now see how to add the call now button to your navigation menu without a plugin. Don&#8217;t worry. You don&#8217;t need to code anything for that. </p>\
<p>Just go to your WordPress dashboard and click on <strong>Appearance &raquo; Menu</strong>. Now click on the custom link tab on your right. You will see 2 different fields here. </p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/manually-add-call-nowbutton.png" alt="" width="552" height="400" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236776" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/manually-add-call-nowbutton.png 552w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/manually-add-call-nowbutton-300x217.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 552px) 100vw, 552px" /></p>\
<p>In the link field, just add your phone number. In the text box, you can add the anchor text that you want on your button. Complete the process by clicking on the Add to Menu option. That&#8217;s it, your Call Now option will now be added to the navigation menu. </p>\
<h3>Tracking Your Call Now Button Clicks</h3>\
<p>Now that you have successfully added the call now button, wouldn&#8217;t it be great if you can track them too? This step is possible only if you use the WP Call Button Plugin for the process. </p>\
<p>You can do it by integrating the plugin with Google Analytics. All you need to do is install the <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com" rel="noopener" target="_blank">MonsterInsights plugin</a>, which lets you track every activity on your website. </p>\
<p>Here&#8217;s a detailed guide on <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/wordpress-plugins/monsterinsights/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">using MonsterInsights</a>. </p>\
<p>So that&#8217;s it!</p>\
<p>We hope this article helped you add the call-now button to WordPress. </p>\
<p>You might also want to check out <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/how-to-create-a-free-business-email/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">how to create a free business email</a>.  </p>\

<p>The post <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.isitwp.com/migrate-to-wordpress-from-any-cms/">How to Migrate to WordPress From Any CMS or Site (Step-by-Step)</a> appeared first on <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.isitwp.com">IsItWP - WordPress Technology Lookup Tool</a>.</p>\
";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:32:"http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/";a:1:{s:7:"creator";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:14:"Editorial Team";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:40:"http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/";a:1:{s:7:"encoded";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:20465:"<p>Do you want to migrate to WordPress from any CMS or website? </p>\
<p>It&#8217;s totally fine if you already have built a website on any platform or CMS. As your business grows, anytime you can migrate your website to WordPress, no matter which CMS you use. Not only is it cheaper to run a site on WordPress, but it also gives you endless possibilities to enhance your site with any features you can think of, like integrating an eCommerce storefront, forums, niche social network, etc. </p>\
<p>In this article, we&#8217;ll show you how to migrate to WordPress from any CMS or website.</p>\
<h3>The Ultimate WordPress Migration Guide</h3>\
<p>Here are the exact steps we&#8217;ll cover in our step-by-step WordPress migration guide:</p>\
<ol>\
<li><a href="#identify">Identify Your Website Platform: Static or CMS</a></li>\
<li><a href="#choosehosting">Choose a WordPress Hosting</a></li>\
<li><a href="#installwp">Install WordPress and Select a Theme</a></li>\
<li><a href="#export">Export Your Existing Website</a></li>\
<li><a href="#import">Import the Website Into WordPress</a></li>\
<li><a href="#redirects">Manage Redirects and Permalinks</a></li>\
<li><a href="#aftermigration">Things to Do After Migration</a></li>\
</ol>\
<h3>Why Should You Move Your Website to WordPress?</h3>\
<p>WordPress is the <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/best-website-builders-for-beginners-compared/" title="10 Best Website Builders for Beginners">most popular website builder</a> in the world. It&#8217;s highly flexible and easy to customize. A lot of <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/popular-big-name-brands-using-wordpress/" title="46 Biggest Brands in the World Using WordPress Actively">biggest brands in the world are using WordPress</a> to manage their sites.</p>\
<p>WordPress can be managed without any coding or programming knowledge. It also comes with many built-in features that make it the top choice for beginners and developers alike.</p>\
<p>Let&#8217;s take a look at some key reasons that make people choose WordPress over other platforms.</p>\
<p><strong>SEO-Friendly:</strong> Whether yours is a small business site, portfolio site or any other, WordPress makes it easy to optimize your site for SEO. You can choose a custom SEO-friendly permalink structure with a few clicks. By installing an SEO plugin, you can easily add meta description, meta title and other SEO information, without having to hard code your site.</p>\
<p><strong>Easy to Customize:</strong> With the advent of <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/best-wordpress-gutenberg-blocks-plugins/" title="14 Best WordPress Gutenberg Plugins to Enhance Your Editor">Gutenberg editor</a> and WordPress Customizer, using WordPress is now easier than ever!. Just make any edits and see the changes instantly right within your dashboard without having to preview the page.</p>\
<p>For more reasons, check out our complete guide on <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/why-use-wordpress/" title="Why Use WordPress? 9 Reasons Why It's the Best Site Builder">why you should use WordPress</a>.</p>\
<p>Before you start, it&#8217;s important to know that there are <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/wordpress-com-vs-wordpress-org-one-really-better/" title="WordPress.com vs. WordPress.org – Is One Really Better Than the Other?" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">two kinds of WordPress platforms</a>. WordPress.com, which is a hosted solution and WordPress.org, which is a self-hosted platform. For this guide, we&#8217;ll use self-hosted WordPress.org as it gives you full control over your site.</p>\
<p>Let&#8217;s start migrating to WordPress from any CMS or website, step by step.</p>\
<p><strong>Note</strong>: Before you dive in, this tutorial assumes you have a dynamic CMS-based website. If you have a static/HTML site, you might want to <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/hire-a-professional-wordpress-developer/" title="How to Hire a Professional WordPress Developer (8 Places)">hire a professional developer</a> to move your site to WordPress.</p>\
<h3 id="identify">Step 1: Identify Your Website Platform: CMS or Static</h3>\
<p>The first thing you need to do is to find out whether the source website is built on top of a Content Management System or just a static / HTML site. A content management system lets you customize your site from the backend.</p>\
<p>You can find out whether your site is dynamic or static by going to Wappalyzer.com. Then enter your site&#8217;s domain name in the box and figure out if it uses any application.</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordpress-migration-from-CMS-technology-lookup.jpg" alt="wordpress migration from CMS technology lookup" width="703" height="454" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236763" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordpress-migration-from-CMS-technology-lookup.jpg 703w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordpress-migration-from-CMS-technology-lookup-300x194.jpg 300w" sizes="(max-width: 703px) 100vw, 703px" /></p>\
<p>If your website is not built with any application, then you might want to <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/hire-a-professional-wordpress-developer/" title="How to Hire a Professional WordPress Developer (8 Places)">hire a professional developer</a> to move your site to WordPress. </p>\
<p>Migration process differs based on the application your website is built with. </p>\
<ul>\
<li>Proceed to the next step if your site is built with a custom CMS</li>\
<li><a href="https://www.isitwp.com/move-from-blogger-to-wordpress-resolved/" title="The 2019’s Guide to Moving a Blog From Blogger to WordPress (Resolved)">Blogger to WordPress migration guide</a></li>\
<li><a href="https://www.isitwp.com/how-to-switch-from-wix-to-wordpress-step-by-step/">Wix to WordPress migration guide</a></li>\
<li><a href="https://www.isitwp.com/move-website-weebly-wordpress/" title="How to Move Your Website From Weebly to WordPress">Weebly to WordPress migration guide</a></li>\
<li><a href="https://www.isitwp.com/medium-to-wordpress/">Medium to WordPress migration guide</a></li>\
<li><a href="https://www.isitwp.com/move-godaddy-wordpress/">Godaddy Website Builder to WordPress migration guide</a></li>\
</ul>\
<h3 id="choosehosting">Step 2: Choose a WordPress Hosting</h3>\
<p>To start a website on self-hosted WordPress.org, you’ll have to own a domain name and a web hosting account.</p>\
<p>A domain name is the URL (for example, isitwp.com) that people will type in their browsers to access your website. A web hosting is a space where you&#8217;ll store all your content and files. For more details, check out the <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/difference-between-domain-name-and-web-hosting-revealed/" title="What’s the Difference Between Domain Name and Web Hosting? (REVEALED)">differences between a domain name and web hosting</a>.</p>\
<p>While there are dozens of <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/hosting-reviews/wordpress/" title="The Best WordPress Hosting Companies">WordPress hosting</a> out there, we recommend using <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/refer/bluehost/" title="Bluehost" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">Bluehost</a>. It&#8217;s one of the most popular web hosting providers and an officially recommended hosting service by WordPress.org.</p>\
<p>We&#8217;ve negotiated a deal with Bluehost to offer our users a free domain name, <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/get-free-ssl-certificate/" title="How to Get a Free SSL Certificate in Minutes (HTTPS)">free SSL certificate</a>, and great discount on web hosting.</p>\
<p><a href="https://www.isitwp.com/refer/bluehost/" title="Bluehost" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank"><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/bluehost-website.jpg" alt="bluehost-website" width="740" height="381" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-234365" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/bluehost-website.jpg 740w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/bluehost-website-300x154.jpg 300w" sizes="(max-width: 740px) 100vw, 740px" /></a></p>\
<p><a href="https://www.isitwp.com/refer/bluehost/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow" class="btn ltgreen light">Click Here to Claim This Exclusive Bluehost Offer &raquo;</a></p>\
<p>Go to <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/refer/bluehost/" title="Bluehost" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">Bluehost</a> website and click on the <strong>Get started</strong> button. Next, you need to select a hosting plan for your new WordPress website. Let&#8217;s choose the basic plan as you&#8217;re just getting started. It includes a free domain name and free SSL certificate. You can always upgrade later as your site grows.</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/select-a-bluehost-plan-to-start-a-blog.jpg" alt="select a bluehost plan for restaurant website" width="775" height="483" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-218256" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/select-a-bluehost-plan-to-start-a-blog.jpg 775w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/select-a-bluehost-plan-to-start-a-blog-300x187.jpg 300w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/select-a-bluehost-plan-to-start-a-blog-768x479.jpg 768w" sizes="(max-width: 775px) 100vw, 775px" /></p>\
<p>After that, you need to select a domain name. You can either use an existing domain that you own or register a new one for free.</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-domain-purchase.jpg" alt="bluehost domain purchase" width="775" height="468" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-218266" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-domain-purchase.jpg 775w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-domain-purchase-300x181.jpg 300w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-domain-purchase-768x464.jpg 768w" sizes="(max-width: 775px) 100vw, 775px" /></p>\
<p>On the next page, you need to enter your account information. For easy registration, you can sign in with Google and complete the setup in a few clicks.</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-account-creation.png" alt="bluehost account creation" width="775" height="482" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-218267" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-account-creation.png 775w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-account-creation-300x187.png 300w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-account-creation-768x478.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 775px) 100vw, 775px" /></p>\
<p>Now, scroll down to the package information box. There are multiple options, including a basic plan for 12 months, 24 months, or 36 months. You can also see that a few addons are preselected, adding up the total price. We recommend unchecking the addons because you won&#8217;t need these right away. You can always purchase them later whenever you want.</p>\
<p>To get the best price on web hosting, select the 36-month plan.</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-package-information.jpg" alt="bluehost package information" width="775" height="360" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-218263" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-package-information.jpg 775w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-package-information-300x139.jpg 300w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/bluehost-package-information-768x357.jpg 768w" sizes="(max-width: 775px) 100vw, 775px" /></p>\
<p>Moving ahead, you need to scroll down further to enter your payment details. You have to agree to their &#8216;Terms of Service&#8217; and then, click <strong>Submit</strong>.</p>\
<p>In the next step, you need to create a password for your hosting account. You&#8217;ll receive an email with details on how to log in to your web hosting control panel (cPanel) where you can manage your hosting files, emails, and support.</p>\
<p>For more details on Bluehost, check out our complete <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/hosting-reviews/bluehost-review/" title="Bluehost Review">Bluehost review</a>.</p>\
<h3 id="installwp">Step 3: Install WordPress and Select a Theme</h3>\
<p>After purchasing the domain name and web hosting, you need to install WordPress. Many web hosting providers, including Bluehost, offer 1-click WordPress installation to save you time.</p>\
<p>You need to go to your <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/refer/bluehost/" title="Bluehost" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">Bluehost</a> account. From there, you can click on the WordPress icon to add the name and tagline of your website. You also need to choose your WordPress theme and click on the <strong>Install</strong> button.</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/theme-directory.jpg" alt="Theme directory" width="775" height="400" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236426" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/theme-directory.jpg 775w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/theme-directory-300x155.jpg 300w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/theme-directory-768x396.jpg 768w" sizes="(max-width: 775px) 100vw, 775px" /></p>\
<p>Since there are thousands of free WordPress themes, it&#8217;s intimidating to find the right one for your site. All themes have different features and options. A good theme should include beautiful template design, navigation menu, sidebars, widget support, shortcodes, and page templates.</p>\
<p>You might also want to check out the <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/top-wordpress-themes/" title="The Best and Most Popular WordPress Themes (UPDATED)">best and most popular WordPress themes</a> of all times.</p>\
<p>For the sake of this guide, we&#8217;ll use the <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/refer/astra-wordpress-theme/" title="Astra Theme" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">Astra Theme</a>. It&#8217;s a popular and multipurpose WordPress theme built to create any website.</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/astratheme.png" alt="Astra theme" width="775" height="300" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236427" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/astratheme.png 775w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/astratheme-300x116.png 300w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/astratheme-768x297.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 775px) 100vw, 775px" /></p>\
<h3 id="export">Step 4: Export Your CMS-Based Website</h3>\
<p>Exporting an existing or source website from a CMS is so easy. In the admin section of your site, there&#8217;ll be an option to export the XML file with complete content, media, and database. You&#8217;ll need to store this file on your computer for the migration.</p>\
<h3 id="import">Step 5: Import Your CMS-Based Website into WordPress</h3>\
<p>The best way to import XML exported files into WordPress is by using a plugin called <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-all-import/" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">WP All Import</a>. </p>\
<p>WP All Import has a <a href="http://www.wpallimport.com/documentation/getting-started/importing-an-xml-or-csv-file/" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">4-step import process</a>. It&#8217;s drag and drop interface makes the complicated importing process quick and easy. </p>\
<h3 id="redirects">Step 6: Manage Redirects and Permalinks</h3>\
<p>You need to add redirects on your website to preserve search engine rankings. When a user visits an old URL, it&#8217;ll redirect to the same page on your new WordPress site.</p>\
<p>Simply follow this step by step guide on <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/beginners-guide-to-creating-redirects-in-wordpress/" title="How to Set Up Redirects in WordPress" rel="noopener" target="_blank">setting up redirects in WordPress</a>.</p>\
<p>The next thing you need to do is to manage the permalinks structure. In the WordPress admin area, visit <strong>Settings &raquo; Permalinks</strong> to select a URL format.</p>\
<p><img src="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/permalinks-structure.jpg" alt="Permalinks structure" width="775" height="335" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-236472" srcset="https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/permalinks-structure.jpg 775w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/permalinks-structure-300x130.jpg 300w, https://www.isitwp.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/permalinks-structure-768x332.jpg 768w" sizes="(max-width: 775px) 100vw, 775px" /></p>\
<p>You can also create a custom permalink structure if you&#8217;d like.</p>\
<h3 id="aftermigration">Step 7: Things to do After Migration</h3>\
<p>After a successful migration to WordPress, the next thing you need to do is to leverage the full potential of WordPress. </p>\
<p>There are thousands of free and premium WordPress plugins available on the market. These plugins will help you boost the functionality of your website within a few clicks. You might also want to check out our list of <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/top-wordpress-plugins/" title="30 Best WordPress Plugins that You MUST Use">must-have WordPress plugins</a>.</p>\
<p>Take a look at some of the most popular plugins that you need to install on your WordPress website after the migration:</p>\
<ul>\
<li><strong><a href="https://wpforms.com/" title="WPForms" target="_blank">WPForms</a>:</strong> It&#8217;s the most beginner friendly WordPress contact form plugin. You can use WPForms to <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/add-contact-form-wordpress-website/" title="How to Create a Contact Form on WordPress (the Easy Way)">add a contact form</a>, survey form, user registration form, and any type of custom form on your website.</li>\
<li><strong><a href="https://monsterinsights.com" title="MonsterInsights" rel="noopener" target="_blank">MonsterInsights</a>:</strong> It&#8217;s the most popular Google Analytics plugin. This plugin will show complete insights and traffic reports within your WordPress dashboard, so you can improve the website and grow your traffic.</li>\
<li><strong><a href="https://optinmonster.com" title="OptinMonster" rel="noopener" target="_blank">OptinMonster</a>:</strong> OptinMonster helps you convert your visitors into subscribers and customers. It&#8217;s the most powerful lead generation and conversion optimization plugin in existence. You can also use their <a href="https://optinmonster.com/exit-intent/" title="Exit Intent" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Exit-Intent&reg;</a> technology to display offers and deals to the abandoning visitors and ask them to subscribe to your email list.</li>\
<li><strong><a href="https://www.isitwp.com/refer/backupbuddy/" title="BackupBuddy" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">BackupBuddy</a>:</strong> This plugin will help you maintain backups of your WordPress website. In case, if anything goes wrong or your website is hacked, you can restore everything within a few minutes using BackupBuddy.</li>\
<li><strong><a href="https://www.isitwp.com/refer/sucuri/" title="Sucuri" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">Sucuri</a>:</strong> Talking about malware and hacking, Sucuri is a popular WordPress security plugin. It secures your website from all kind of malicious activities and hackers.</li>\
</ul>\
<p>Your website may look fine and running smoothly, but it&#8217;s recommended to test the site on multiple browsers to look for any possible errors. For more details, check out this guide on <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/beginners-guide-to-troubleshooting-wordpress-errors-step-by-step/" title="Beginner’s Guide to Troubleshooting WordPress Errors (Step by Step)" rel="noopener" target="_blank">troubleshooting common WordPress errors</a>.</p>\
<p>We hope this article helped you learn how to migrate to WordPress from any CMS. You may also want to check out our guide on <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/how-to-transfer-wordpress-from-local-server-to-a-live-site-step-by-step/" title="How to Transfer WordPress from Local Server to a Live Site (Step by Step)">how to transfer WordPress from a local server to a live site</a>.</p>\
<p>The post <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.isitwp.com/migrate-to-wordpress-from-any-cms/">How to Migrate to WordPress From Any CMS or Site (Step-by-Step)</a> appeared first on <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.isitwp.com">IsItWP - WordPress Technology Lookup Tool</a>.</p>\
