<li>Simple one page theme perfect for professionals</li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<p>Free.</p>\
<h3>24. <a href="https://wordpress.org/themes/xtron/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Xtron</a></h3>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/themes/xtron/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-549604" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/one-page-resume-wordpress-theme.jpg" alt="one page resume wordpress theme" width="1116" height="858" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/one-page-resume-wordpress-theme.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/one-page-resume-wordpress-theme-300x231.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/one-page-resume-wordpress-theme-768x590.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/one-page-resume-wordpress-theme-1024x787.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></a></p>\
<p>Looking for free WordPress resume themes in 2019? <a href="https://wordpress.org/themes/xtron/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Xtron</a> is a great pick since it doesn&#8217;t cost a cent and requires very little setup.</p>\
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>\
<ul>\
<li>Minimalist design</li>\
<li>Slide-in navigation menu</li>\
<li>Compatible with page builder plugins</li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<h3>25. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/resume-builder/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Resume Builder</a> (BONUS PLUGIN)</h3>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/resume-builder/" target="_blank" rel="=nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone wp-image-549421 size-full" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/resume-builder-plugin.jpg" alt="resume builder plugin" width="1116" height="630" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/resume-builder-plugin.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/resume-builder-plugin-300x169.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/resume-builder-plugin-768x434.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/resume-builder-plugin-1024x578.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></a></p>\
<p>Although there&#8217;s no <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/resume-builder/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Resume Builder</a> WordPress theme, they do have an excellent plugin. It&#8217;s perfect if you already have a <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-free-wordpress-themes/">WordPress theme</a> that you love and want to add your work history with an easy-to-use WordPress resume plugin.</p>\
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>\
<ul>\
<li>Drag and drop resume builder</li>\
<li>Sections for skills, education, and experience</li>\
<li>Works with most WordPress themes</li>\
<li>Stunning default resume template</li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<p>Free.</p>\
<h3>In Conclusion</h3>\
<p>There you have it! Hopefully, this post helped you find the best WordPress resume theme for your job search.</p>\
<p>And don&#8217;t forget to add WordPress skills on your resume since you built your resume website yourself, you rock star!</p>\
<p>Consider having employers reach you through your site&#8217;s contact form and check out our post on the <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-free-wordpress-contact-form-plugins/">best free form plugins for WordPress</a>.</p>\

\	\	\	\	\	\	\	";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";s:5:"child";a:5:{s:0:"";a:7:{s:5:"title";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:71:"Entry Management Just Got Better — Export Filters + Entries Dashboard";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:4:"link";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:53:"https://wpforms.com/entry-management-just-got-better/";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:8:"comments";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:62:"https://wpforms.com/entry-management-just-got-better/#comments";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:7:"pubDate";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:31:"Thu, 29 Aug 2019 12:00:50 +0000";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:8:"category";a:5:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:12:"Announcement";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:1;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:12:"form entries";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:2;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:11:"form export";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:3;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:15:"lead generation";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:4;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:15:"collect entries";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:4:"guid";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:29:"https://wpforms.com/?p=548481";s:7:"attribs";a:1:{s:0:"";a:1:{s:11:"isPermaLink";s:5:"false";}}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:11:"description";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:613:"<p>Today we’re thrilled to announce that WPForms 1.5.5 has arrived. It’s now going to be simpler than ever to view and export form submissions from your site. You’ll be able to make better business decisions because you now have much more control over your form entries information. Here’s what’s happening in WPForms 1.5.5. Improved Entries [&#8230;]</p>\
<p>The post <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpforms.com/entry-management-just-got-better/">Entry Management Just Got Better — Export Filters + Entries Dashboard</a> appeared first on <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpforms.com">WPForms</a>.</p>\
";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:32:"http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/";a:1:{s:7:"creator";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:12:"Lisa Gennaro";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:40:"http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/";a:1:{s:7:"encoded";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:5562:"<p>Today we’re thrilled to announce that WPForms 1.5.5 has arrived.</p>\
<p>It’s now going to be simpler than ever to view and export form submissions from your site. You’ll be able to make better business decisions because you now have much more control over your form entries information.</p>\
<p>Here’s what’s happening in WPForms 1.5.5.</p>\
<h3>Improved Entries Exporting Experience</h3>\
<p>As WPForms has grown, so have our users. So many of you have become power users and have asked us for more control over exporting your form entries.</p>\
<p>Previously, the only way to export entries in WPForms was to go to the Entries area, click on view, and click on the Download Entries (CSV) button to save them all to your computer. And sometimes, that export wasn&#8217;t always reliable for those of you with tens of thousands of entries.</p>\
<p>There were also no filters and you would get all the entries from your forms — with no other options or report customizations.</p>\
<p>The new Entry Export feature can handle a massive amount of entries and lets you filter which ones you want to export. That way, you can save time finding the data you need inside your form submissions.</p>\
<p>You&#8217;ll find the Export Entries feature under Tools » Export. It includes several filters for you to select or deselect based on the data you&#8217;d like on your exported CSV file including:</p>\
<ul>\
<li>Form Fields</li>\
<li>Additional Entry Information</li>\
<li>Date</li>\
<li>Search</li>\
</ul>\
<p>Want to quickly see the emails you&#8217;ve collected from a form but don&#8217;t want all the other info that was submitted? Use these checkboxes to customize which form fields will show up on your exported report to make things a little bit easier.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-548490" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/improved-entry-exporting.jpg" alt="improved entry exporting" width="1116" height="692" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/improved-entry-exporting.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/improved-entry-exporting-300x186.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/improved-entry-exporting-768x476.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/improved-entry-exporting-1024x635.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>You can even add additional info, such as <a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/geolocation-addon/">Geolocation data</a> or <a href="https://wpforms.com/addons/stripe-addon/">Stripe payment</a> info if you&#8217;re using those addons. Plus, you’ll be able to search through your form fields to look for or exclude specific information.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-548492" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/additional-info.png" alt="additional info" width="1116" height="786" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/additional-info.png 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/additional-info-300x211.png 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/additional-info-768x541.png 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/additional-info-1024x721.png 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>The Entry Exporting experience is much more polished and we think it&#8217;s going to make using WPForms even easier.</p>\
<h3>New Default Entries Page</h3>\
<p>Before, the Entries screen defaulted to the first form you made. Often, the first form you&#8217;ve ever created isn&#8217;t your most popular form. So, it wasn&#8217;t super useful to display that form as the default on this page.</p>\
<p>We wanted to make it simpler and faster to see your form entries. With this latest release, when you click on Entries you&#8217;ll now see an Entries Overview Dashboard with your forms&#8217; total entries instead.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-548505" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/entries-page.jpg" alt="entries page" width="1116" height="795" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/entries-page.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/entries-page-300x214.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/entries-page-768x547.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/entries-page-1024x729.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>You&#8217;ll see all your forms on this new page, sorted by the amount of entries in the date range you select.</p>\
<p>You can also check out the All Time entries total and click on the Graph button to see <a href="https://wpforms.com/survey-data-visualization-tools/">data visualization</a> of any of your forms. You&#8217;ll see a quick overview and be able to tell how your forms are performing with just a glance.</p>\
<p>And that covers it for the 2 new features you’ll find in WPForms 1.5.5. Try the latest version and keep us posted on what you think.</p>\
<p>As always, thank you for your continued support of WPForms. We look forward to helping you succeed with your website and business.</p>\
<p><em>Lisa and the WPForms team</em></p>\
<p>P.S. Don’t have a WPForms Pro license? <a href="http://wpforms.com/pricing">Click here to get started today</a> and experience the WPForms difference.</p>\

\	\	\	\	\	\	\	";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";s:5:"child";a:5:{s:0:"";a:7:{s:5:"title";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:64:"How to Create a Click To Call Button (the Easy Way) on WordPress";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:4:"link";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:50:"https://wpforms.com/create-a-click-to-call-button/";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:8:"comments";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:58:"https://wpforms.com/create-a-click-to-call-button/#respond";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:7:"pubDate";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:31:"Mon, 26 Aug 2019 12:00:37 +0000";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:8:"category";a:6:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:19:"WordPress Tutorials";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:1;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:15:"mobile friendly";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:2;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:13:"wordpress.org";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:3;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:12:"phone fields";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:4;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:14:"small business";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}i:5;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:22:"internet phone systems";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:4:"guid";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:29:"https://wpforms.com/?p=542234";s:7:"attribs";a:1:{s:0:"";a:1:{s:11:"isPermaLink";s:5:"false";}}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:11:"description";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:551:"<p>Want to create a Click to Call button on your WordPress website? Since over 50% of web traffic happens on mobile devices, you want to make it easy for potential and current customers to call you with a simple click. In this tutorial, we&#8217;ll show you exactly how to add a Click to Call button [&#8230;]</p>\
<p>The post <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpforms.com/create-a-click-to-call-button/">How to Create a Click To Call Button (the Easy Way) on WordPress</a> appeared first on <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpforms.com">WPForms</a>.</p>\
";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:32:"http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/";a:1:{s:7:"creator";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:12:"Lisa Gennaro";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:40:"http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/";a:1:{s:7:"encoded";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:16077:"<p>Want to create a Click to Call button on your WordPress website?</p>\
<p>Since over 50% of web traffic happens on mobile devices, you want to make it easy for potential and current customers to call you with a simple click.</p>\
<p>In this tutorial, we&#8217;ll show you exactly how to add a Click to Call button to your WordPress site.</p>\
<h3>Why Add a Click to Call Link?</h3>\
<p>It&#8217;s very important as a small business owner to collect as high-quality leads as possible.</p>\
<p>Not everyone wants to give you their <a href="https://wpforms.com/how-to-setup-a-free-business-email-address/">email address</a> or telephone numbers, but they still might want to do business with you.</p>\
<p>Give them a chance to do it by letting them call you — and to make it as easy as possible, add a clickable phone number button.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542382" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-now-button-desktop-users-or-mobile-devices.jpg" alt="call now button desktop users or mobile devices" width="558" height="302" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-now-button-desktop-users-or-mobile-devices.jpg 558w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-now-button-desktop-users-or-mobile-devices-300x162.jpg 300w" sizes="(max-width: 558px) 100vw, 558px" /></p>\
<p>Since more and more people are using their mobile device to search the web, users sometimes want to speak with a person right away on the same device.</p>\
<p>Luckily there&#8217;s a <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-call-button" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">clickable phone numbers button plugin called WP Call Button</a> that does this for you without you having to know any html code. You don&#8217;t have to be very technical to use it.</p>\
<p>Next, let&#8217;s take a look at how to add a Click to Call Now Button on WordPress using this plugin.</p>\
<h3>How Do I Add a Click to Call Button in WordPress</h3>\
<p>Asking yourself how do I make a phone number button clickable in WordPress? It&#8217;s super easy with the (free) WP Call Button plugin. Just follow these steps:</p>\
<h3>Step 1. Install the Free WP Call Button Plugin</h3>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-call-button" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Click here to download the WP Call Button</a> from WordPress.org.</p>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-call-button" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542356" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-a-click-to-call-button-to-your-wordpress-site-in-minutes.jpg" alt="add a click to call button to your wordpress site in minutes" width="1116" height="529" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-a-click-to-call-button-to-your-wordpress-site-in-minutes.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-a-click-to-call-button-to-your-wordpress-site-in-minutes-300x142.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-a-click-to-call-button-to-your-wordpress-site-in-minutes-768x364.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-a-click-to-call-button-to-your-wordpress-site-in-minutes-1024x485.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></a></p>\
<p>For detailed instructions, check out <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/step-by-step-guide-to-install-a-wordpress-plugin-for-beginners" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">how to install a WordPress plugin for beginners</a>.</p>\
<h3>Step 2. Locate the WP Call Button Plugin Settings</h3>\
<p>Once you&#8217;ve activated the plugin on your WordPress site, you&#8217;ll want to configure the settings to your liking.</p>\
<p>To find the WP Call Button settings area, go to the left-hand panel of your WordPress dashboard and click on <strong>Settings</strong> » <strong>WP Call Button</strong>.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542340" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/how-to-configure-wp-call-button-settings.jpg" alt="how to configure wp call button settings" width="1116" height="772" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/how-to-configure-wp-call-button-settings.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/how-to-configure-wp-call-button-settings-300x208.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/how-to-configure-wp-call-button-settings-768x531.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/how-to-configure-wp-call-button-settings-1024x708.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>This settings page will open on the Sticky Call Button page. This type of button appears on the bottom of the user&#8217;s screen and moves up and down as they scroll, so it&#8217;s always visible. It&#8217;s also the most popular type of Click to Call buttons because it converts extremely well.</p>\
<h3>Step 3. Enter Your Business Phone Number</h3>\
<p>Now, enter your <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-business-voip-and-internet-phone-systems/">business telephone number</a> where you want to receive the phone calls coming from your website visitors.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542498" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/phone-number-area.png" alt="phone number area" width="1116" height="192" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/phone-number-area.png 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/phone-number-area-300x52.png 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/phone-number-area-768x132.png 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/phone-number-area-1024x176.png 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>The WP Call Button plugin uses the smart phone number field which means you can pick your country and it will automatically add the country code in the proper format.</p>\
<p>If you don’t have a business phone number, then you can get one from <a title="Nextiva" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/nextiva/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Nextiva</a>. You can control how you forward the calls to places including mobile phones instead of just landlines.</p>\
<h3>Step 4. Edit the Button Text</h3>\
<p>Next, you can change the call button text to say whatever you like. Simply click inside the text box where the default message &#8220;Call Us&#8221; is and edit it.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542553" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-call-button-text.png" alt="edit call button text" width="1116" height="162" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-call-button-text.png 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-call-button-text-300x44.png 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-call-button-text-768x111.png 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-call-button-text-1024x149.png 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>Editing the Click to Call button text will only work if you have a button in a Full-width position (it&#8217;s the only one that displays text). We&#8217;ll talk about button positions in the next step.</p>\
<h3>Step 5. Pick the Button Position</h3>\
<p>Now, decide which call button position works best for your website. There are 4 choices. However, <strong>full-width buttons</strong> receive the most conversions and will be the most effective to get you more online leads.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542559" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-button-position.jpg" alt="select button position" width="1116" height="315" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-button-position.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-button-position-300x85.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-button-position-768x217.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-button-position-1024x289.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<h3>Step 6. Edit the Button Color</h3>\
<p>Next, you&#8217;ll want to edit the color of the phone call link button. Try using one of your business&#8217; brand colors or a color that matches your <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-wordpress-themes-for-small-business/">small business WordPress theme</a>.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542567" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/change-button-color.jpg" alt="change button color" width="1116" height="180" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/change-button-color.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/change-button-color-300x48.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/change-button-color-768x124.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/change-button-color-1024x165.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<h3>Step 7. Pick the Call Button Visibility</h3>\
<p>Decide where you want your call button to be shown. It&#8217;s popular to display it everywhere on your site, so that&#8217;s the default. But you can also show it and/or hide it on only certain pages or posts.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542569" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-button-visibility.jpg" alt="call button visibility" width="1116" height="272" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-button-visibility.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-button-visibility-300x73.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-button-visibility-768x187.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/call-button-visibility-1024x250.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<h3>Step 8. Save Changes</h3>\
<p>Click on the green Save Changes button on the bottom left of the settings page once everything in the settings is configured to your liking.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542572" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-the-save-changes-button.jpg" alt="select the save changes button" width="1116" height="571" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-the-save-changes-button.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-the-save-changes-button-300x153.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-the-save-changes-button-768x393.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/select-the-save-changes-button-1024x524.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<h3>Step 9. Turn Your Button on</h3>\
<p>When you&#8217;ve successfully configured all the WP Call Button settings the way you want them, scroll to the top of the page and click on the green toggle icon to turn your Click to Call button on.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542583" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/display-call-now-button-on.jpg" alt="display call now button on" width="1116" height="569" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/display-call-now-button-on.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/display-call-now-button-on-300x153.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/display-call-now-button-on-768x392.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/display-call-now-button-on-1024x522.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>Now you can visit your site and see the call button in action.</p>\
<h3>Step 10: Set Up a Static Click to Call Button (Optional)</h3>\
<p>You also have the option to add a static call button in your WordPress contact page, about page, or any other post/page on your site.</p>\
<p>A static Click to Call button will stay in place even when the user scrolls away, so it&#8217;s not always visible.</p>\
<p>To add your static Click to Call button, create a new page or post in WordPress and click on the plus icon. Here, you&#8217;ll select the <strong>WP Call Button</strong> block.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542517" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-wp-call-button-to-site-static.jpg" alt="add wp call button to site static" width="1116" height="610" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-wp-call-button-to-site-static.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-wp-call-button-to-site-static-300x164.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-wp-call-button-to-site-static-768x420.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-wp-call-button-to-site-static-1024x560.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>Inside the block editor on the right, you can change the font size, plus the color of the static button background and text.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542601" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-your-call-button-block.jpg" alt="edit your call button block" width="1116" height="720" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-your-call-button-block.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-your-call-button-block-300x194.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-your-call-button-block-768x495.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/edit-your-call-button-block-1024x661.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>Next, select the blue <strong>Publish</strong> button in the top right corner to make your page or post live. Then, the static button will be displayed on your site.</p>\
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-542603" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-call-us-button-to-wordpress-website.jpg" alt="add call us button to wordpress website" width="1116" height="433" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-call-us-button-to-wordpress-website.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-call-us-button-to-wordpress-website-300x116.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-call-us-button-to-wordpress-website-768x298.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/add-call-us-button-to-wordpress-website-1024x397.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></p>\
<p>After reading this, you can probably see why we recommend WP Call Button to add a call us now button to your website. It&#8217;s definitely the easiest and most powerful WordPress Click to Call button plugin on the market.</p>\
<p>And the coolest part of this awesome plugin is that it’s 100% free.</p>\
<p>Plus, it works with <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-google-analytics-plugins-for-wordpress/">Google Analytics</a> if you&#8217;re using the <a href="http://monsterinsights.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">MonsterInsights</a> plugin. It automatically tracks how many people click on your Click to Call button, so you can sit back and focus on <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/make-money-online/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">making more money online</a>.</p>\
<h3>In Conclusion</h3>\
<p>And there you have it! We hope this tutorial helped you add a Click to Call button, to your WordPress site easily.</p>\
<p>You might also want to check out our post on the <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-business-voip-and-internet-phone-systems">best internet phone systems and VoIP for small business</a>.</p>\

<p>The post <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpforms.com/best-wordpress-security-plugins/">7 Best WordPress Security Plugins to Protect Your Website (2019)</a> appeared first on <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpforms.com">WPForms</a>.</p>\
";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:32:"http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/";a:1:{s:7:"creator";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:12:"Lisa Gennaro";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}}s:40:"http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/";a:1:{s:7:"encoded";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:18426:"<p>Are you trying to keep your website safe?</p>\
<p>Using a security tool on your WordPress site is essential to having a successful business online.</p>\
<p>In this post, we&#8217;ve rounded up the very best WordPress security plugins to protect your website in 2019.</p>\
<h3>Do I Need a WordPress Security Plugin?</h3>\
<p>If you&#8217;re asking yourself are WordPress security plugins necessary? Know this stat — The average website is attacked <strong>44 times every day</strong>.</p>\
<p>And if any of those attacks are successful, it could seriously hurt your business online.</p>\
<p>That&#8217;s why your <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wordpress-security/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WordPress site security</a> and online security measures should be at the top of your priorities.</p>\
<p>Some of the negative things that can happen with a security breach include:</p>\
<ul>\
<li>Online criminals can steal the data belonging to you and your customers</li>\
<li>Private data from your business and your customers could be exposed</li>\
<li>Your website content can be completely deleted</li>\
<li>Your site could distribute malware to your visitors hurting your brand and SEO rankings</li>\
<li><a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/beginners-step-step-guide-fixing-hacked-wordpress-site/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Fixing your hacked WordPress site</a> can be a complicated and costly process</li>\
</ul>\
<p>All of these reasons make having a WordPress security plugin installed on your site incredibly important.</p>\
<p>So now that you know the risks of an unsecured website and the reasons why you need a WordPress security plugin, let&#8217;s talk about the top choices.</p>\
<p>This list of the best WordPress security plugin in 2019 should help you pick which one works best for you and your business.</p>\
<h3>What Is the Best WordPress Security Plugin in 2019?</h3>\
<p>So which WordPress security plugin is best for you? Let&#8217;s take a peek at the list:</p>\
<h3>1. <a title="Sucuri" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/sucuri/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Sucuri</a></h3>\
<p><a title="Sucuri" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/sucuri/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-512215" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/sucuri-best-cdn-provider-to-speed-up-your-website.png" alt="best free wordpress security plugin" width="1116" height="489" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/sucuri-best-cdn-provider-to-speed-up-your-website.png 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/sucuri-best-cdn-provider-to-speed-up-your-website-300x131.png 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/sucuri-best-cdn-provider-to-speed-up-your-website-768x337.png 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/sucuri-best-cdn-provider-to-speed-up-your-website-1024x449.png 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></a></p>\
<p>The best free WordPress security plugin available today is Sucuri. The all-in-one security platform is wildly popular for good reason.</p>\
<p>Although <a title="Sucuri" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/sucuri/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Sucuri</a> is a great free WordPress security plugin for websites, the pro version is actually the real must-have.</p>\
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>\
<ul>\
<li>They&#8217;ll clean up your WordPress site at no additional cost if it gets malware</li>\
<li>Firewall protection helps you block brute force and malicious attacks from accessing your WordPress site</li>\
<li>Lets you conduct malware scanning</li>\
<li>Keeps track of everything that happens on your site, including file changes, last logins, and failed login attempts</li>\
<li>Can reduce server load time and improve your site’s performance by blocking malicious traffic</li>\
<li>Serves static content from their own <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-cdn-providers/">CDN servers</a></li>\
<li>Protects your website against SQL Injections, XSS, and all known attacks</li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<p>There&#8217;s a free version of Sucuri and the Pro version is $299/year.</p>\
<p><a title="Sucuri" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/sucuri/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Click here to get started with Sucuri today</a>.</p>\
<h3>2. <a title="iThemes Security" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/ithemes-security/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">iThemes Security Pro</a></h3>\
<p><a title="iThemes Security" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/ithemes-security/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-540660" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ithemes-security-pro-wordpress-sites.png" alt="ithemes security pro wordpress sites" width="1116" height="452" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ithemes-security-pro-wordpress-sites.png 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ithemes-security-pro-wordpress-sites-300x122.png 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ithemes-security-pro-wordpress-sites-768x311.png 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ithemes-security-pro-wordpress-sites-1024x415.png 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></a></p>\
<p>If you&#8217;re a WordPress user, you might be familiar with the team that created <a title="iThemes Security" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/ithemes-security/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">iThemes Security Pro</a> since they also built the popular <a title="BackupBuddy" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/backupbuddy/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">BackupBuddy</a> plugin. All of their tools offer an easy-to-use interface for brute force security protection and more.</p>\
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>\
<ul>\
<li>Two-factor authentication for an extra layer of security</li>\
<li>Powerful password enforcement</li>\
<li>404 detection and plugin scans</li>\
<li>Scheduled <a href="https://www.isitwp.com/best-wordpress-backup-plugins-compared/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WordPress backups</a></li>\
<li>Locks out any suspicious IP that scans for vulnerabilities on your site</li>\
<li>Sends email alerts to notify you of any recent file updates on your site that may be malicious</li>\
<li>Ability to limit login attempts</li>\
<li>Although there&#8217;s no website firewall or malware scanner, they do use <a title="Sucuri" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/sucuri/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Sucuri</a>&#8216;s Sitecheck malware scanner</li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<p>iThemes Security Pro pricing starts at $80/year.</p>\
<div class="alert alert-warning"><p>Don&#8217;t forget, a secure website starts with <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-wordpress-hosting-guide/">solid WordPress hosting</a>.</p>\
</div>\
<h3>3. <a title="Jetpack" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/jetpack/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Jetpack Security</a></h3>\
<p><a title="Jetpack" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/jetpack/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-540671" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/jetpack-security-protects-your-wordpress-sites.jpg" alt="jetpack security protects your wordpress sites" width="1116" height="388" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/jetpack-security-protects-your-wordpress-sites.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/jetpack-security-protects-your-wordpress-sites-300x104.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/jetpack-security-protects-your-wordpress-sites-768x267.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/jetpack-security-protects-your-wordpress-sites-1024x356.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></a></p>\
<p>Another popular all-in-one solution on our list of the best WordPress security plugins is <a title="Jetpack" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/jetpack/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Jetpack</a>. This well-known plugin lets you easily scan your website for security vulnerabilities and has over 5 million active installs.</p>\
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>\
<ul>\
<li>Alerts you via email the moment it detects that your WordPress site is down</li>\
<li>Protects your site against brute force login attacks, spam, and harmful malware</li>\
<li>Site backups and 1-click restore</li>\
<li>Includes website design features and <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-marketing-automation-software/">automated marketing</a> tools</li>\
<li>Automatic comment filtering</li>\
<li>Organized site activity and events dashboard</li>\
<li>Provides secure authentication via WordPress accounts</li>\
<li>Keeps your <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-free-wordpress-plugins-for-your-website/">WordPress plugins</a> automatically updated</li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<p>There&#8217;s a free version with very little functionality, so you&#8217;ll want the Premium version which starts at $9/month.</p>\
<h3>4. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wordfence/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Wordfence</a></h3>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wordfence/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-540677" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordfence-security.png" alt="wordfence security" width="1116" height="413" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordfence-security.png 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordfence-security-300x111.png 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordfence-security-768x284.png 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordfence-security-1024x379.png 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></a></p>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wordfence/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Wordfence</a> is a free plugin that has some amazing security features that protects your WordPress site without you having to spend a cent.</p>\
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>\
<ul>\
<li>Free to use for as many sites as you need</li>\
<li>Monitors visits and hack attempts in real time including origin, their IP address, the time of day, and time spent on your site</li>\
<li>Tracks and alerts you about breached password usage so you can create a new strong password immediately</li>\
<li>Protects from brute force attacks with limiting failed login attempts</li>\
<li>Runs on your own server instead of being cloud-based, so could slow your site</li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<p>Wordfence is free.</p>\
<h3>5. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/bulletproof-security/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">BulletProof Security</a></h3>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/bulletproof-security/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-540678" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordpress-user-security-vulnerabilities.png" alt="wordpress user security vulnerabilities" width="1116" height="338" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordpress-user-security-vulnerabilities.png 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordpress-user-security-vulnerabilities-300x91.png 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordpress-user-security-vulnerabilities-768x233.png 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wordpress-user-security-vulnerabilities-1024x310.png 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></a></p>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/bulletproof-security/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">BulletProof Security</a> is a WordPress security plugin that doesn&#8217;t look all that cool, but gets you some basic security features for free, so it&#8217;s worth being on the list.</p>\
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>\
<ul>\
<li>A somewhat easy-to-use setup wizard</li>\
<li>Malware scanning and firewalls</li>\
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/how-to-save-your-contact-form-data-in-wordpress-database/">Database</a> backups</li>\
<li>Login protection</li>\
<li>Email notifications with security logs when a user gets locked out from failed login attempts</li>\
<li>Idle session logouts</li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<p>BulletProof Security is free.</p>\
<h3>6. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/all-in-one-wp-security-and-firewall/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">All In One WP Security &amp; Firewall</a></h3>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/all-in-one-wp-security-and-firewall/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-540681" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/best-wordpress-security-plugin-in-2019.png" alt="best wordpress security plugin in 2019" width="1114" height="478" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/best-wordpress-security-plugin-in-2019.png 1114w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/best-wordpress-security-plugin-in-2019-300x129.png 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/best-wordpress-security-plugin-in-2019-768x330.png 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/best-wordpress-security-plugin-in-2019-1024x439.png 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1114px) 100vw, 1114px" /></a></p>\
<p>It&#8217;s easy (and free) to use <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/all-in-one-wp-security-and-firewall/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">All In One WP Security &amp; Firewall</a> to apply most WordPress best practices for security to your <a href="https://wpforms.com/best-website-builder-for-small-business/">small business website</a>. But the tool is pretty basic and not as beginner-friendly as the more well-known solutions.</p>\
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>\
<ul>\
<li>Scanning for malicious patterns</li>\
<li>IP filtering to block specific people and geographical locations</li>\
<li>Login lockdowns after failed login attempts</li>\
<li>View a list of locked out users to unlock individuals in just a few clicks</li>\
<li>A password strength tool to allow you to generate appropriately strong passwords</li>\
<li>User account monitoring</li>\
<li>A website-level firewall (but does lack a DNS-level firewall)</li>\
<li>Lets you manually blacklist <a href="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-tutorials/how-to-block-ip-addresses-in-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">suspicious IP addresses</a></li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<p>All In One WP Security &amp; Firewall is free.</p>\
<h3>7. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/miniorange-2-factor-authentication/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Google Authenticator</a></h3>\
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/miniorange-2-factor-authentication/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-540688" src="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/google-authenticator.jpg" alt="google authenticator" width="1116" height="523" srcset="https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/google-authenticator.jpg 1116w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/google-authenticator-300x141.jpg 300w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/google-authenticator-768x360.jpg 768w, https://wpforms.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/google-authenticator-1024x480.jpg 1024w" sizes="(max-width: 1116px) 100vw, 1116px" /></a></p>\
<p>Setting up two-factor authentication for extra security is a really good idea to keep your website secure. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/miniorange-2-factor-authentication/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Google Authenticator</a> lets you do just that. And it&#8217;s on our list since most security plugins don&#8217;t include this.</p>\
<p><strong>Features:</strong></p>\
<ul>\
<li>Adds an extra layer of security to your login</li>\
<li>Has a simple interface and is moderately easy-to-use</li>\
<li>Lets you pick which type of two-factor authentication you want to use</li>\
<li>Offers shortcodes so you can do things like use it on <a href="https://wpforms.com/how-to-create-a-custom-login-form-for-improved-site-branding/">custom login pages</a></li>\
</ul>\
<p><strong>Cost:</strong></p>\
<p>Free.</p>\
<h3>The Best WordPress Security Plugin Winner</h3>\
<p>If you&#8217;re looking for a WordPress security plugin that has it all, there answers fairly obviously which you should choose.</p>\
<p>Our pick for the very best WordPress security plugin goes to <a title="Sucuri" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/sucuri/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Sucuri</a>, without a doubt. It comes with all the features you&#8217;ll need to protect your website, instead of just a few.</p>\
<p>This includes website scanning, DNS-level firewalls (not just website), and their own cloud-based server and CDN network.</p>\
<p>If you haven&#8217;t already, we recommend that you get started with <a title="Sucuri" href="https://wpforms.com/refer/sucuri/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Sucuri</a> as soon as possible. The Premium version isn&#8217;t free, but having a secure website&#8217;s going to save you a ton of potential costs and headaches in the event of a breach (Not to mention, peace of mind).</p>\
<h3>In Conclusion</h3>\
<p>And that&#8217;s it. Hopefully, this list of the best WordPress security plugins helped give you the info you need to find the best security tool for you.</p>\
<p>You may also really like our post with some awesome <a href="https://wpforms.com/proven-strategies-for-creating-secure-wordpress-forms/">proven strategies for creating secure WordPress forms</a>.</p>\

File Upload Form in WordPress in 2019 (Step by Step)";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:4:"link";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:66:"https://wpforms.com/how-to-create-a-file-upload-form-in-wordpress/";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:8:"comments";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:75:"https://wpforms.com/how-to-create-a-file-upload-form-in-wordpress/#comments";s:7:"attribs";a:0:{}s:8:"xml_base";s:0:"";s:17:"xml_base_explicit";b:0;s:8:"xml_lang";s:0:"";}}s:7:"pubDate";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:"data";s:31:"Mon,
